snippet: Judging from tax changes in the past, some economists see a mostly mild effect on markets if tax rates on dividends and capital gains rise at the end of the year, as the White House has proposed.
abstract: Some economists predict that potential year-end hikes in tax rates on dividends and capital gains will have only a mild effect on markets; cite minor fallout from 2003 hikes and fact that only a small number of Americans have stocks and bonds in accounts that would be susceptible to increases.
lead_paragraph: Judging from tax changes in the past, some economists see a mostly mild effect on markets if tax rates on dividends and capital gains rise at the end of the year, as the White House has proposed.

headline.seo: Some Economists Doubt Dire Effects From Tax Increases
headline.main: Some Analysts Doubt Dire Predictions on Tax Increase Fallout
headline.print_headline: Some Analysts Doubt Dire Predictions on Tax Increase Fallout
